questions.text: After which British King is the U.S. state of Georgia named?
questions.explanation:
George II.

	King George II was born in 1683 in Herrenhausen Palace in Hanover, Germany. He died at Kensington Palace, London, England on October 25th, 1760.

questions.text: Which famous healer's forenames were Grigory Yefimovitch?
questions.explanation:
Rasputin.

	Rasputin's influence over the ruling family of Russia contributed to the onset of the 1917 Russian Revolution.

questions.text: Who was Britain's second in command at the Battle of Copenhagen?
questions.explanation:
Admiral Lord Nelson.

	The Danish Fleet was destroyed by the British in this naval battle, in order to discourage Sweden and Denmark's financial aid of Napoleon's France.

questions.text: Which type of camel was flown in World War I?
questions.explanation:
The Sopwith Camel.

	The Sopwith camel was a 1918 British war plane, that flew at speeds of up to 200mph and altitudes of 20,000 feet.

questions.text: Which Swede, who saved over 30,000 Jewish lives in World war II, was arrested by the Soviets and never seen again?
questions.explanation:
Raoul Wallenberg.

	While on a diplomatic mission in Budapest, Hungary, in 1944, Wallenberg protected Hungarian Jews by placing them in safe houses that were flying the neutral Swedish flag.

questions.text: In the American Civil War, how many states formed the Confederacy?
questions.explanation:
11.

	South Carolina, Mississippi, Florida, Alabama, Georgia, Louisiana, Texas, Virginia, Arkansas, Tennessee and North Carolina.

questions.text: Which king was restored to the English throne in 1660, after the Commonwealth period?
For what habit did the wife of Rodrigo de Jerez denounce him to the Spanish Inquisition?
questions.explanation:
Smoking.

	One of the first men to set foot on the 'New World', Rodrigo is believed to have been the first European smoker. His wife, upon seeing smoke come out of his nose and mouth, thought he was posessed by evil spirits.

questions.text: The Treaty of Vereeniging ended which war?
questions.explanation:
The Boer War.

	The Boer War was a conflict in southern Africa, between Britain and the allied Transvaal and Orange Free State, from 1899 to 1902.

questions.text: Whose son was Oscar Wilde's friend Bosie?
questions.explanation:
The 8th Marquis of Queensberry.

	The Marquis who was instrumental in redrafting the rules of Boxing, strongly disaproved of the friendship between his son and the great Irish wit.
